availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Moldecar J. W. Ambrose (Bourbon County, Kentucky minister, physician and soldier)

body.p: Bourbon County, Kentucky, minister, physician and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Sophia F. Ambrose. Father of Mary Viola Ambrose, France Phila J. Ambrose, Harrison J. Ambrose, Thomas H. Ambrose, and L.D. Ambrose. Physician in Fleming County, Kentucky in 1850. Methodist minister in Bourbon County, Kentucky in 1860. Served in the 7th Kentucky Cavalry (U.S.A.) from August 17, 1862 to July 10, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, District 1, p. 291B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, Eastern Division, p. 8.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 180.
